channel.title: [Tut] Multi-Column Tableless Layout

item.title: [Tut] Multi-Column Tableless Layout
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:32, topic:477433”]One of the reasons why you shouldn’t use div for everything is that it’s not only confusing for the people working with the source (for example, it’s much clearer that something is a menu when it’s put in a tag), but it’s also to help the browser understanding the page, in case it for some reason can’t render with CSS enabled or something, think of text browsers, or perhaps a browser for a blind person. If you use the tag, the browser will know that a certain link belongs to the site’s navigation, and will be able to communicate that to the person using it, if needed.[/quote]Yeah on top of that, it’ll allow your page to be indexed a lot more efficiently with search engines.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] Multi-Column Tableless Layout
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

One of the reasons why you shouldn’t use div for everything is that it’s not only confusing for the people working with the source (for example, it’s much clearer that something is a menu when it’s put in a tag), but it’s also to help the browser understanding the page, in case it for some reason can’t render with CSS enabled or something, think of text browsers, or perhaps a browser for a blind person. If you use the tag, the browser will know that a certain link belongs to the site’s navigation, and will be able to communicate that to the person using it, if needed.

Read full topic

@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Fox2007, post:26, topic:477433”]@Everyone Else:
I really don’t care about what you think about how i got about something. I don’t post here to be criticized by some wannabe. If i can make ANYTHING that you can in a different way, whats it matter how it’s done, as long as its getting done. Some of us might not be professional as oh SilentCJ here (hehe) but as long as we’re getting the job done effectively, it doesn’t matter how it gets done.

If you’re a person that’s hard to learn anything, then improvise. Not everyone has the required knowledge to make someone great. Cosmetic effects are all that matter to a client, and not how anything is written. If it looks good, they’re happy…so again…

WHAT THE love DOES IT MATTER[/quote]I can tell you haven’t actually read anything I posted. It’s your loss.

item.title: [Tut] Multi-Column Tableless Layout
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Fox2007, post:23, topic:477433”]Look what else got made with nothing but DIV tags: http://prntscr.com/nyvsh
And this: http://prntscr.com/nyvud

So assuming those were made, i guess you can use DIV tags the same as any other tag.
Honestly, idgaf. To me its all the same, and I can accomplish the same thing.

The minecraft is actually a SMF Portal. Stick it in an SMF directory it displays forum news and everything >.>
The redfox remake was a long time ago, and havent bothered improving it.[/quote]Obviously you can misuse any tag for any purpose. I could create a website using the tag if I wanted to, it’s irrelevant. You should be sticking to semantic naming and using tags for their intended purpose.

http://html5doctor.com/lets-talk-about-semantics/

h5d-sectioning-flowchart.png1095×775

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] Multi-Column Tableless Layout
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[code=html][/code]
You should be using and recommending the HTML5 doctype.
MDN Web Docs

Introduction to HTML5

HTML5 is the fifth revision and newest version of the HTML standard. It offers new features that provide not only rich media support but also enhance support for creating web applications that can interact with users, their local data, and servers...

[code=html][/code]
The keywords meta is completely useless.
en.wikipedia.org

Meta element

Meta elements are tags used in HTML and XHTML documents to provide structured metadata about a Web page. They are part of a web page's head section. Multiple Meta elements with different attributes can be used on the same page. Meta elements can be used to specify page description, keywords and any other metadata not provided through the other head elements and attributes. The meta element has two uses: either to emulate the use of an HTTP response header field, or to embed additional metadata wi...

[code=html]
Hello, World!<> This is an example of a block, within a block. <>

[/code]Not sure what this is but you aren’t closing your tags properly.

[code=css]div.leftcolumn {[/code]
Your class names should describe what the content is, not what it looks like or where it's placed. Look into semantic HTML.
[code=html]
This is the left column title<>[/code]Why are you using
for everything? They should be a last resort for separating blocks and sections of the page. Consider using the header (h1, h2, h3, etc.) for describing titles.

MDN Web Docs

<div>: The Content Division element

The HTML Content Division element (div) is the generic container for flow content. It has no effect on the content or layout until styled using CSS.


MDN Web Docs

<h1>–<h6>: The HTML Section Heading elements

The HTML h1 – h6 elements represent six levels of section headings. h1 is the highest section level and h6 is the lowest.

[code=css]a.button { text-decoration:none; color: #0000FF; } a.button:hover { text-decoration:none; color: #0000FF; } a.button:active { text-decoration:none; color: #0000FF; }[/code]
Could be shortend to the following: [code=css] a.button, a.button:hover, a.button:active { text-decoration:none; color: #0000FF; } [/code]
[code=html]
test<>
test<>
test<>
test<>
test<> <>[/code]Again, what are you describing here? Navigation links? Sort of looks like a list you might say.
MDN Web Docs

<ul>

The HTML ul element represents an unordered list of items, typically rendered as a bulleted list.

i can make any website that you can using strictly
tags ....... and probably more >.>You can also make them all with font tags, it's irrelevant and stupid to use
tags for everything.

This is terrible information and you should consider revising it.

didn't realize there was a global law that prevented people from using tags how they wanted....my bad. dont call the police. >.>
http://validator.w3.org/

Read full topic
